create_central_kitchen.ponder.tag.cookin: Components which automate the cooking process
create_central_kitchen.ponder.basket.bel: Receiving Items from Belt using Basket
The Basket can receive transported items from belt.
Besides facing upwards, corresponding horizontal facing is also suitable.
create_central_kitchen.ponder.basket.int: Collecting Dropped Items using the Basket
Like the Hopper, the Basket can collect dropped items.
What's more, Baskets can have different facings.
However, the Basket can't extract items from containers.
create_central_kitchen.ponder.blaze_stov: The Blaze Stove can provide mechanical arm support for kitchenware like Cooking Pot, but it needs to be configured to work.
Right-Click the Blaze Stove to open the Cooking Guide menu.
You may also Right-Click the Blaze Stove with any Guide to swap them.
Once you assigned a valid recipe to the Cooking Guide, the Cooking Pot above will become interactive with Mechanical Arms.
For input, the Mechanical Arm will insert containers and defined ingredients.
For output, the Mechanical Arm will extract result and invalid ingredients.
Use the Blaze Stove as a Heat Source
The Blaze Stove is an active heat source, the hotter the fire, the faster the cooking.
But cooking can still be done with passive heat.
Of course, you can also use the Blaze Stove to fry things directly.
But please note that seething fire can burn your ingredients in an instant.
To create a Blaze Stove, Right-Click the Blaze Burner with a Cooking Guide in hand when sneaking.
Cooking Guides are for Cooking Pots, other guides for different kitchenware are also applicable.
To retrieve the Cooking Guide, Right-Click the Blaze Stove with wrench when sneaking.
create_central_kitchen.jei.transfer.copp: Amount of ingredients exceeds Copper Pot's capacity
_: Thank you for translating Create: Central Kitchen!
